posts.post_content: @Deathdark: Please go look up the official rules; few things in Magic work the way you would think just through logical reasoning :-) Once blockers are declared, that's it - any creatures that are blocked stay blocked, no matter what happens afterwards. In the examples you cite, you could unsummon, exile, or otherwise remove a blocking creature with an instant right after you declare attackers, BEFORE the opponent can declare blockers. But you can't do that with this Knight's ability because it requires the creature to already be blocking the Knight in order to be targeted. And once that happens, he is already blocked until end of combat. If you just think of the Knight's ability as some sort of super first strike, it will make more sense to you.
posts.html:
@Deathdark: Please go look up the official rules; few things in Magic work the way you would think just through logical reasoning :-) Once blockers are declared, that's it - any creatures that are blocked stay blocked, no matter what happens afterwards. In the examples you cite, you could unsummon, exile, or otherwise remove a blocking creature with an instant right after you declare attackers, BEFORE the opponent can declare blockers. But you can't do that with this Knight's ability because it requires the creature to already be blocking the Knight in order to be targeted. And once that happens, he is already blocked until end of combat. If you just think of the Knight's ability as some sort of super first strike, it will make more sense to you.

posts.post_content:
I like to give her [Sadistic Glee](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sadistic Glee) (or [Blade of the Bloodchief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blade of the Bloodchief)) and treat her like a Slith. "If Knight of Dusk becomes blocked, pay ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), destroy blocking creature and put a +1/+1 counter on Knight of Dusk." Not to mention she'd get bonus-ed if other creatures die for any reason.  
  
Take two, or take more later.

posts.post_content:
In the later game, with mana available and several of these, I could see her working in a {B}{G} deck with [Lure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lure). They block with all their creatures, and you pick off the ones you want to for {B}{B} apiece.  
  
Casual, yes, but still potent. She gets a solid 4 from me for interesting combat tricks.
